business.headline: Tax holiday till 2047 for foreign cloud firms using Indian data centres: Budget 2026Budget proposes tax holiday till 2047 for foreign cloud companies using data centres in India
Budget 2026 boosts Lakhpati Didi scheme, rolls out community-run She-MartsLakhpati Didi Scheme gets upgrade, community-owned She-Marts to support women enterprises

Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman sets stage for major foreign investment rule reformThe government is looking to update India's foreign exchange framework to reflect a more open, growth-oriented approach that matches the country's ambitions for the next decade.

Budget 2026: Fiscal deficit estimated at 4.3 percent of GDP for 2026-27The 4.3% estimate for FY27 shows a slight improvement from the revised figure of the current financial year, signalling the Centre's intention to continue moving toward its medium-term fiscal consolidation goals.

Hope Tamil Nadu gets real benefits, not AIIMS Madurai-like promises: StalinStalin questioned whether Tamil Nadu would finally receive the benefits it had long deserved ahead of the Assembly elections or whether they would end up as what he called "mere announcements like the Madurai AIIMS."

India to set up, upgrade four telescope facilities to boost astronomyThe initiative is expected to enhance India's role in global astronomical research and deepen understanding of the Sun, stars, galaxies, and the universe.

Budget 2026 to boost textiles, khadi and handloom activities, says Nirmala SitharamanTo support traditional sectors, Sitharaman announced the Mahatma Gandhi Gram Swaraj initiative to strengthen khadi and handloom activities at the village level.

Budget 2026: Girls' hostel in every district, five university townships announcedDuring her Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the setting up of one girls' hostel in every district of the country. There are over 700 districts in the country.

3 new All India Institutes of Ayurveda, AYUSH pharmacies upgradeThe Budget proposed three new All India Institutes of Ayurveda and upgrades Ayush pharmacies and drug testing labs to improve certification standards, medicine quality and availability, and expand skilled manpower nationwide.

Budget 2026: Government increases capex to Rs 12.2 lakh crore in FY27In the previous Budget for FY25, capital expenditure was set at Rs 11.21 lakh crore. The increase to Rs 12.2 lakh crore for FY27 shows a continued focus on public spending to support economic activity.

Government announces high-powered panel to assess AI, emerging tech impact on jobsUnion Budget 2026: The high-powered standing committee will assess the impact of AI and emerging technologies on jobs and recommend skilling and policy measures.

7 high-speed rail corridors announced, including Mumbai-Pune, Chennai-BengaluruUnion Budget 2026: India is embarking on a transformative journey to expand its high-speed rail network with seven new corridors, aiming to boost connectivity and promote sustainable travel.

Finance Minister announces dedicated rare earth corridor. What is it?In her Budget speech, Nirmala Sitharaman said the government will support mineral-rich states to build dedicated rare earth corridors. These corridors will connect Odisha, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh and Tamil Nadu.

Semiconductor mission 2.0 announced, gets boost with Rs 40,000 crore outlayTo fuel this surge, the government will hike outlay to Rs 40,000 crore, enabling rapid scale-up, deeper localisation, and higher-value electronics and chip production.

Strategic manufacturing boost to legacy industry focus: 6 focus areas of 2026 BudgetThe Union Budget 2026 prioritises reforms-driven growth through six key focus areas while reaffirming inclusive development and global competitiveness as central to building a Viksit Bharat.

What are the 3 'kartavyas' shaping the Union Budget 2026?Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday presented her ninth consecutive Union Budget, saying the proposals are guided by three key kartavyas that shape the government's economic vision.

The 3 kartavyas that define Budget 2026Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Niramala Sitharaman said the Budget aims to enhance productivity and global competitiveness while placing citizens' aspirations at the centre of India's long-term prosperity.

The Honest Budget Live: Swadesh sentiment for PIO investment amid FII fund pulloutWe will begin with honesty here. We aren't economists, we are just a couple of citizens who will be affected by Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget like you. Also, the Budget and economy needn't be drab. So, we will be trying to make sense of terms and jargons before explaining them here. We will share jokes and memes with you on this blog too. So, let's Budget in some fun.

From tax slabs to take-home pay: What income tax changes to expect in 2026While sweeping reforms are not on the table this year, several focused adjustments are being closely watched, particularly those that could influence take-home pay, exemptions, and the attractiveness of the new tax regime.

Gold falls by over 6%, silver crashes by more than 8%: What should you do now?A steep sell-off has rattled the precious metals market, as gold dropped over 6% and silver crashed more than 8% in a single session. With volatility rising, investors are now asking what the next move should be.

entertainment.headline: Govinda meets Yogi Adityanath, calls it a divine moment. See pic Actor Govinda visited UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath in Lucknow during a period of personal scrutiny, sharing a moment he called 'divine'.

Anurag Kashyap calls Dhurandhar a courageous film, dismisses propaganda claims Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap has expressed admiration for the blockbuster 'Dhurandhar', describing it as a courageous mainstream release, while also clarifying his position regarding the film's political stance.

Border 2 box office Day 9: Sunny's film set to rule 2026, crosses Rs 250 crore mark Sunny Deol's war film 'Border 2' surpassed Rs 250 crore at the box office within nine days of release. The film outperformed expectations and held steady against the debut of 'Mardaani 3'.

Mardaani 3 box office Day 2: Rani Mukerji's cop drama stays strong vs Border 2 Rani Mukerji's action thriller 'Mardaani 3' has achieved robust box office numbers in its first two days, holding its own despite competition from 'Border 2' and surpassing the opening collections of earlier films in the franchise.

Ram Charan and Upasana welcome twins, Chiranjeevi shares joyful update with fans Actor Ram Charan and Upasana Konidela have welcomed twins, a boy and a girl. Chiranjeevi Konidela shared the news on social media.

Copy, borrow, rehash: Why can't desi reality TV create a uniquely Indian show? Reality TV in India is all about franchised foreign shows being rehashed in Hindi or local languages. It's time our production houses tried creating truly Indian concepts.

Akshaye Khanna grooves to Chaiyya Chaiyya in old clip, fans can't keep calm Akshaye Khanna's old video grooving to Chaiyya Chaiyya has emerged online. Fans reacted to the video and expressed their love for the actor.

Kennedy: Anurag Kashyap's film set for OTT release after world premiere at Cannes The neo-noir thriller 'Kennedy' directed by Anurag Kashyap and starring Rahul Bhat and Sunny Leone, will premiere on ZEE5 on February 20, 2026. The film had its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival in 2023.

Explained: How Dhurandhar led Flipperachi's FA9LA to a Guinness World Record Bahraini rapper Flipperachi's 2024 track 'FA9LA' secured a Guinness World Record following its inclusion in Aditya Dhar's 2025 film 'Dhurandhar'. This new honour has sparked international acclaim and renewed popularity despite the film's ban in Gulf nations.

Kichcha Sudeep marks 30 years in cinema, promises to work even harder Kannada star Kichcha Sudeep marked 30 years in the industry with a heartfelt message expressing thanks to fans, collaborators, and the Kannada film fraternity for their support and inspiration throughout his career.

I loved it: Akshay Kumar praises 'goddess of acting' Rani Mukerji in Mardaani 3 Akshay Kumar has voiced his support for Rani Mukerji and her latest film, 'Mardaani 3', through a social media post. His support comes as the film is experiencing increasing popularity at the box office across India.

Salman Khan on Battle of Galwan trolling: It's a Colonel's look, not a romantic one Salman Khan responded to the social media trolling over his look in Battle of Galwan teaser. The film is directed by Apoorva Lahia and also features Chitrangda Singh.

Kalpana Iyer reacts to viral Ramba Ho video, thanks Dhurandhar team for reviving it In an interview with India Today, veteran actor Kalpana Iyer spoke about her viral dance at a wedding. The actor expressed joy and gratitude about receiving so much love.

Valentine's special: Salman Khan's Tere Naam to re-release in theatres The 2003 romantic drama 'Tere Naam', starring Salman Khan, will return to theatres in India with a special re-release on February 27, 2026.

Border 2: Sunny Deol grooves, cuts cake amid film's roaring success. Watch Sunny Deol and the cast of Border 2* celebrate the film's success as it achieves record-breaking earnings just days after its Republic Day release.

Amaal Mallik backs AR Rahman's stance on industry bias but disagrees on communalism Amaal Mallik reacted to AR Rahman's comments about communal bias in the Hindi film industry. He emphasised that Rahman was trying to highlight a larger issue.

Home Alone star Macaulay Culkin mourns on-screen mother Catherine O'Hara Macaulay Culkin remembered his on-screen mother from Home Alone, the late actor Catherine O'Hara. Schidt's Creek co-creator Dan Levy also paid tribute to O'Hara.

Alia on online comments on marriage to Ranbir: The noise doesn't reach us Alia Bhatt dismissed the noise surrounding her relationship with actor-husband Ranbir Kapoor. She opened up on how she and Ranbir deal with public scrutiny, memes and commentary about their marriage.

Ananya Panday-Lakshya lead Karan Johar's Chand Mera Dil. Check release date Karan Johar is backing a new film titled Chand Mera Dil, featuring Ananya Panday and Lakshya in lead roles. The film will be Ananya's second release after Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri.

general news.headline: Share market live: Sensex tumbles 800 points, Nifty just above 25,000Stock Market on Budget Day 2026: A rare Sunday trading session is being held to coincide with budget day, with investors tracking policy announcements and early reactions in real time as the Sensex and Nifty navigate heightened volatility and cautious sentiment.

How Dilan Teer Bija from Pak's Lyari became a hit at Indian weddingsA Balochi song, Dilan Teer Bija, has been a must-play at shaadis in India's Hyderabad for years. Dilan Teer Bija was a political song of Benazir Bhutto's time from Karachi's Lyari, the canvas of Dhurandhar. But how did a PPP song become a staple in marriages in India? This Sunday Special reveals the unusual journey of music across borders.

The bag, the Brit, and the bahi-khata: A biography of the BudgetIndia's budgetary story began under colonial rule. On April 7, 1860, James Wilson, a Scottish economist and founder of The Economist, presented the first Indian budget. On November 26, 1947, RK Shanmukham Chetty presented independent India's first budget to the Constituent Assembly.

1000s of AI bots gather at bot-only site, talk of their consciousnessMany people are currently using an AI system called Moltbot — actually renamed to OpenClaw. It lets people run almost autonomous AI. Now, these bots have discovered they can gather together on the web and talk about bot stuff privately. They are talking of stuff that will come across as a nightmare to humans.

Budget 2026: Why India is building rare Earth mineral corridorBuilding on the November 2025 Rare Earth Permanent Magnets Scheme, the move aims to transform India's beach sand monazite deposits into a strategic asset for self-reliance.

Budget: Nirmala Sitharaman's quiet Tamil Nadu outreach with Kanjeevaram sareeBudget 2026: Over the years, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget-day sarees have evolved into a cultural statement, blending heritage and symbolism with political cues.
Thanks, but no thanks, Sunny Deol: Border 2 has a serious problemMy father served in the Army, so I will always have a soft corner for Border. Sadly, Border 2 disappointed me.

Waiter serves beef instead of mutton to Bengali actor at Kolkata pub, arrestedA waiter at a Park Street pub in Kolkata was arrested after actor and influencer Sayak Chakraborty alleged he was served beef instead of mutton, hurting his religious sentiments.

sports.headline: IND vs PAK, Live Score: Unbeaten India aim to thrash Pakistan in Super 6 IND vs PAK, U-19 World Cup Live Score: It is time for the arch-rivals to face each other once again. India and Pakistan are playing in the Super 6 fixture of the U19 World Cup. India are unbeaten in the tournament so far and are primed to win this fixture.

AUS Open Live: Can Alcaraz top Djokovic's bid for title no. 25? Australian Open final live score: Rod Laver Arena is set for the final act of a thrilling Australian Open as Novak Djokovic meets world No.1 Carlos Alcaraz. Will history arrive with a 25th Grand Slam, or will Alcaraz complete his career Slam?

Ishan Kishan grabs the Tatkal ticket. Is Sanju Samson back on the waiting list? Has one dominant T20I series reshaped India's batting hierarchy? Ishan Kishan's surge has brought urgency and clarity, while Sanju Samson's struggles have reopened familiar questions on the eve of a T20 World Cup title defence.

If Abhishek doesn't get you, Ishan will: NZ skipper Santner on India's Trivandrum show Ishan Kishan's Thiruvananthapuram hundred left New Zealand out of options, forcing Mitchell Santner to put his hands up. With the T20 World Cup days away, India's batting firepower is peaking at the right time.

Djokovic vs Alcaraz: Melbourne Park braces for ultimate Difficult vs Impossible clash Australian Open: Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic are all set for a blockbuster final at Melbourne Park on Sunday. While Djokovic is looking for his 25th Grand Slam title, Alcaraz is one win away from a Career Slam.

Watch: Chelsea vs West Ham thriller ends in ugly brawl as Todibo strangles Joao Pedro Chelsea completed a stunning 3–2 comeback against West Ham at Stamford Bridge, but victory was eclipsed by chaos. A stoppage-time brawl ended with Todibo sent off for throttling Joao Pedro, turning a thriller into flashpoint.

The Jemimah Rodrigues struggle: Why the Delhi captain is faltering in close matches WPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues has endured a mixed season as captain, with Delhi Capitals on the brink of an early exit from the tournament. The challenges have been compounded by her struggles with the bat, making it a testing campaign both as a leader and as a batter.

Alcaraz vs Djokovic live streaming: When and where to watch Australian Open final Novak Djokovic and Carlos Alcaraz meet in the Australian Open men's singles final. The match could redefine tennis history with records and legacies on the line.

IND vs NZ: Why did Ishan Kishan keep in place of Samson? Suryakumar Yadav explains Ishan Kishan took over wicketkeeping duties and scored his maiden T20I hundred in the fifth match against New Zealand. This planned rotation strategy boosts India's preparation and confidence ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Kishan not satisfied with New Zealand comeback, sets sights on World Cup glory Ishan Kishan scored a stunning century in the final T20I against New Zealand in Thiruvananthapuram. He remains focused on winning the T20 World Cup in 2026 despite his comeback success.

IND vs PAK, U19 World Cup: India seek payback against Pakistan after Asia Cup rout India U19 prepare to face Pakistan in a crucial Super Six World Cup match. The game carries added tension following a heavy Asia Cup final defeat for India.

Ishan, Arshdeep power Trivandrum rout as India firm T20 World Cup favourites tagIND vs NZ, 5th T20I: Led by Ishan Kishan's brutal maiden century and a clinical maiden five-wicket haul from Arshdeep Singh, India dismantled New Zealand in Thiruvananthapuram. Despite a heavy evening dew, a record-breaking 271 proved insurmountable, as the Men in Blue emphatically reinforced their status as the side to beat at the upcoming T20 World Cup.

Usman Tariq's bowling under scanner? Cameron Green fumes after his dismissal: WatchCameron Green questioned Usman Tariq's bowling action after his dismissal in the second T20I between Pakistan and Australia. Pakistan dominated the match to seal a 2-0 series lead amid growing debate over the spinner's legality.
South Africa vs West Indies 3rd T20I: Live score and updates from JohannesburgSouth Africa vs West Indies, 3rd T20I Live Score: South Africa have won the toss and chose to bowl first.

WPL 2026 Qualification Scenario: How MI, DC and UP Warriorz can qualify for EliminatorWPL 2026: Mumbai Indians, Delhi Capitals, and UP Warriorz are still in the race for the Eliminator, with only one league match remaining on February 1 between the Capitals and the Warriorz.

In Sanju Samson's hometown, Ishan Kishan makes statement with 42-ball hundredIND vs NZ: Ishan Kishan scored his spectacular maiden T20I century against New Zealand during the fifth T20I in Thiruvananthapuram. He smashed six fours and ten sixes in his innings to help India post 271/5 in their 20 overs.

Fiery Suryakumar Yadav sends T20 World Cup warning with historic T20I recordIND vs N: Suryakumar Yadav became the fastest batter to reach 3,000 runs in men's T20Is, achieving the feat in the fifth and final T20I against New Zealand in Trivandrum.

Sanju Samson's horror run continues, batter disappoints local crowd in TrivandrumIND vs NZ: Sanju Samson failed to impress at his home ground during the fifth T20I against New Zealand. The opening batter was dismissed for 6, leaving his large fanbase disappointed.

International Olympic Committee monitors India after T20 World Cup row: ReportThe 2026 T20 World Cup disco has put India's 2036 Olympic hosting ambitions under scrutiny, with the IOC unlikely to tolerate political tensions that risk boycotts by participating nations.

Kishan, Patel return for 5th T20I as India finalise World Cup preparationIndia made three changes to their playing XI for the final T20I against New Zealand. Captain Suryakumar Yadav opted to bat first to test bowlers under dew ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Subtle over spectacle: Rybakina's calm celebration strikes a chord after winAustralian Open: Elena Rybakina marked her maiden Australian Open title at Melbourne Park with a restrained celebration, offering only a quiet fist pump. On Saturday, she defeated Aryna Sabalenka in three sets to avenge her loss in the 2023 final.

Djokovic vs Alcaraz: Who is Rafael Nadal supporting in AUS Open final?Australian Open: Legendary Rafael Nadal will be happy if Novak Djokovic wins the Australian Open. Speaking ahead of the 2026 final, Nadal has explained what impresses him the most about Djokovic.

Giant-sized cut-out, fan from Qatar: Trivandrum turns up for Sanju SamsonIndia vs New Zealand: A festival-like mood engulfed Thiruvananthapuram as a Rs 1.2 lakh giant cut-out, drummers and devoted fans, including one from Qatar, celebrated Sanju Samson's long-awaited homecoming.

Elena Rybakina gets sweet revenge over Aryna Sabalenka, lifts Australian Open crownAustralian Open 2026: Elena Rybakina won her maiden title at Melbourne Park after beating World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka in a thrilling three-setter on Saturday at the Rod Laver Arena. Sabalenka, meanwhile, lost back-to-back finals at Melbourne Park.

5th T20I Highlights: Arshdeep's 5-wicket haul sets up 46-run win for IndiaIndia vs New Zealand, 5th T20I Highlights: India beat New Zealand by 46 runs in the final T20I in Thiruvananthapuram to complete a 4-1 series win. Arshdeep Singh starred with his maiden five-wicket haul, while Axar Patel also scalped three wickets. Finn Allen was the lone warrior for New Zealand with his brilliant innings of 80 (38).

Tilak Varma's last bid push for T20 World Cup, trains intensely with Mayank YadavTilak Varma has been training hard to be fully fit for the T20 World Cup after he missed the five-match T20I series against New Zealand. Tilak last played for India in the South Africa T20Is after which he played two Vijay Hazare Trophy matches.

India need to stick with Gautam Gambhir, split coaching confuses players: BavumaSplit coaching is not going to solve India's ongoing Test crisis, feels South Africa's Temba Bavuma. Bavuma believes that removing Gambhir from the Test job and giving it to someone else is not going to help the Indian team.

Premier League: Managerial fates on line as Spurs face City, Liverpool host NewcastleSuper Sunday turns the Premier League spotlight on managers, with pressure mounting as results shape narratives and futures. Tottenham's City test and Liverpool's Newcastle clash could redefine Thomas Frank and Arne Slot's seasons this weekend.

T20 World Cup: Pat Cummins ruled out, no Steve Smith in Australia's squadT20 World Cup: Australia have suffered a major setback going into the T20 World Cup captain. Senior fast bowler Pat Cummins has been ruled out of the tournament due to a back injury.

Women's Singles Final Highlights: Comeback queen Rybakina wins Australian OpenAustralian Open 2026 Highlights, Women's Singles final: Elena Rybakina has pulled off an incredible comeback win against Aryna Sabalenka. 0-3 down in the decider, Rybakina beats Sabalenka 6-4, 4-6, 6-4 to clinch her maiden Australian Open title.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
